desc.p: This field contains the query/answer in narrative form.
A maximum of 20 multi-values allowed.
Up to 35 type S (SWIFT) characters.
This field contains the Tag and Tag Content of the Original S.W.I.F.T Message to which the Cancellation, Query or Answer relates.
It is automatically populated when ORG.DE.O.HEADER, ORG.DE.I.HEADER or INWARD.DE.I.HEADER is completed.

Note: Incoming SWIFT messages can contain data which includes two consecutive slashes i.e // which can conflict with OFS terminator strings. For this first release the value will be modified by the OFS mapping process which will insert a space. If the message is to be sent out the space should be removed.
Either the ORG.MSG.NARR or the ORG.MSG.FIELD field can be input.
If the Direction is ‘Outward’ and for cancellation n92 message, if the narrative is “/FRAD/’ then ORG.MSG.FIELD should contain value of original message
Specify whether outward swift message (n92,n95,n96) to be generated using the details entered here.
If Send.Notice is given as "NO", then delivery messages will not be generated and same information is updated in Delivery.Ref field.
In all other cases (Yes OR Null) delivery message is raised and the delivery reference no is updated in Delivery.Ref field.
Valid values "YES" or "NO" or Null
Defaulted to Null.
This field is used to hold the contents of Tag 20 while processing an inward n92, n95 or n96 message.
Standard audit field
Standard audit field
Reserved for future use
Indicates the status of the message.
Valid inputs are NEW, INWORK or PROCESSED.
No input field
Specifies the ID of the Outward Message Header.
This field is mandatory for cancellation messages (MTn92), but otherwise either this field or the ORG.DE.I.HEADER field can be input.
This field defaults the ORIGINAL.MSG.TYPE, ORIGINAL.DATE, REL.REFERENCE and ORG.MSG.FIELD fields when input.
Must be a valid record on the F.DE.O.HEADER File.
Standard Override field
This field is the key to EB.ACTIVITY and EB.ADVICES numbers. It determines the message types to be sent and the mappings to be used.
Mandatory Input for all Outward SWIFT Messages.

tr.td: Request the receiver to consider cancellation of the message identified in the request.
Request information relating to a previous message or amendment to a previous message.
Responds to a MT n95 (Queries Message) or MT n92 (Request for Cancellation) or other messages where no specific message type has been provided for the response.

desc.p: A valid record ID in EB.ADVICES.
Valid inputs are SWIFT Message Types MTn92, MTn95 and MTn96 where n stands for Message Category 1,2,4,5,6,7 or 8.
Indicates the direction of the message.
Valid inputs are INWARD or OUTWARD.
No input field.
This field contains the content of field 20 (Transaction Reference Number) of the original S.W.I.F.T Message to which the Cancellation, Query or Answer relates.
It is automatically populated when ORG.DE.O.HEADER, ORG.DE.I.HEADER or INWARD.DE.I.HEADER is completed.
Mandatory Field
Up to 16 type S (SWIFT) characters.
This field must not start or end with a ‘/’ and must not contain two consecutive slashes ‘//’ (SWIFT Error Code T26)

The common group messages can be used when querying or responding to messages Received or Messages Sent. The SWIFT messages themselves indicate the Message, Message Date and Message Direction (Sent or Received).
This field is used to provide the correct tag for the SWIFT message and is based on the T24 message reference or the User input.

For messages sent from T24 (ref such as D2002121274782374) this would default to S for Sent. For messages received by T24 (such as R20021212243242) it would default to R for Received. If the User is entering a free format query without using the T24 reference then the value needs to be set manually.
Acceptable values of S or R
Defaults according to T24 delivery reference
Standard audit field
This field specifies the message type of the original message to which this cancellation, query or answer relates.
Mandatory if MSG.CNTL.SUFFIX field is‘92’, otherwise optional.
SWIFT Category 3 & 9 Messages are not Allowed, i.e. 300, 320, 900 etc.
This field will be populated automatically and made no input when either the ORG.DE.O.HEADER or ORG.DE.I.HEADER field is input.
1-4 numeric characters.
Must be a valid record on the DE.MESSAGE file.
Reserved for future use
Standard audit field
Standard audit field
Reserved for future use
Specifies the ID of the Inward Message Header. This NOINPUT is populated automatically for Incoming messages only.
This field defaults the ORIGINAL.MSG.TYPE, ORIGINAL.DATE, REL.REFERENCE and ORG.MSG.FIELD of the Incoming Message.
Must be a valid record on the F.DE.I.HEADER File.
Reserved for future use
This noinput field is driven from the Message type as held for the EB.ADVICE.NO.
Valid input will be 1,2,3, 4,5,6,7, 8 or 9.
Where
Customer Transfers and Cheques
Financial Institution Transfers
Foreign Exchange, Money Market and Derivatives
Collections and Cash Letters
Securities Markets
Precious Metals and Syndication
Documentary Credits and Guarantees
Travellers Cheques
Cash Management & Customer Status
Automatically generated field from the EB.ADVICE.NO field. No input possible.
This field holds identies of any advices produced by this application.
Reserved for future use
Reserved for future use
This field contains a narrative description of the original message to which the Cancellation, Query or Answer relates.
This enables the receiver to positively identify that message.
Either the ORG.MSG.NARR or the ORG.MSG.FIELD field can be input.
desc.P: If the Direction is ‘Outward’ and for cancellation n92 message, if the narrative is “/FRAD/’ then ORG.MSG.FIELD should contain value of original message
desc.p: A maximum of 35 multi-values allowed.
Up to 50 type S (SWIFT) characters.
Reserved for future use
Reserved for future use

Represents the reference number to uniquely identify this application. Reference Number format: FMQAyydddNNNNN where, FMQA - Application indicator ; yy - Last two digits of year when transaction is processed ; ddd - Julian day number within year ; NNNNN - Sequential number accepted upto 14 digits
Standard audit field
Specifies the ID of the Inward Message Header. Either this field or the ORG.DE.O.HEADER field can be input.
This field is invalid for cancellation messages (MTn92), but otherwise either this field or the ORG.DE.I.HEADER field can be input.
This field defaults the ORIGINAL.MSG.TYPE, ORIGINAL.DATE, REL.REFERENCE and ORG.MSG.FIELD fields when input.
Must be a valid record on the F.DE.I.HEADER File.
Reserved for future use
Reserved for future use
Input must be an existing CUSTOMER on the Customer File.
The Customer’s SWIFT Address must be held on the DE.ADDRESS File.
If this field is completed and a Swift BIC address is entered in the RECV.ADDR field, then the CUSTOMER.NO field takes precedent.
3 -10 type MNE (0-9, or A-Z uppercase alpha) or '.' or 1-10 Numeric character Customer Code.

This field will contain the SWIFT fields of the original message. The ID of the original message will correspond to the DE.O.HEADER.ID or DE.I.HEADER.ID. The message fields will be specified in the (message type) DE.MESSAGE record, and the (message tags) in the DE.FORMAT.SWIFT record.
This field will correspond to contents of the original outgoing SWIFT message on the F.DE.O.MSG.SWIFT File or the contents of the original incoming SWIFT message on the F.DE.I.MSG File.
Specifies the ID of the original outgoing Message Header. This field will allow the user to automatically populate;
The SWIFT content of the Original Message in the ORG.MAN field.
The Message Type of the Original Message in the ORIGINAL.DATE field
The Date of the Original Message in the ORIGINAL.MSG.TYPE field and
The Transaction Reference Number of the Original Message in the REL.REFERENCE field
Either DE.I.HEADER.ID or DE.O.HEADER.ID is valid.
To change input, e.g. changes from DE.O.HEADER.ID to DE.I.HEADER.ID delete the DE.O.HEADER.ID to make DE.I.HEADER.ID inputtable.
'D' (Delivered) Year (4 numeric characters) Month (2 numeric characters) Day (2 numeric characters) Time (a 7-digit number taken from the computer's internal clock.)
The Delivery Header Id must exist on the DE.O.HEADER File
Standard audit field
Reserved for future use

t.desc:
This noinput field will control whether the query or answer field will be allowed to input.
Identifies the type of message to be raised, i.e. Cancellation, Queries or Answers. Valid input will be ‘92’, ‘95’ or ‘96’.
This field is driven from the Message type as held for the
EB.ADVICE.NO.
If 92 is present, QUERY and ANSWER fields should be disabled.
If 95 is present, QUERY field should be enabled for input, otherwise disable.
If 96 is present, ANSWER field should be enabled for input, otherwise disable.
Validation Rules:
Automatically generated field from the EB.ADVICE.NO field. No input possible.

desc.p: Reserved for future use
System Maintained field. This field holds the mapping key through which the data is mapped in producing a delivery message. This is the same mapping key defined in the EB.ADVICES record.
This field is used to retain the original date on which the original message was sent.
Up to 9 type D date characters (Date format in range 1950 to 2049).
This field will be populated automatically and made no input when either the DE.O.HEADER.ID or DE.O.HEADER.ID field is input.
Mandatory if MSG.CNTL.SUFFIX field is‘92’, otherwise optional.
This field contains the actual questions for the for the MTn95 (requesting amendment to a previous message).
Contains an Enquiry called - List of QUERY Codes for SWIFT n95
This field is Inputtable and Mandatory only if MSG.CNTL.SUFFICX is ‘95’, otherwise optional.
A maximum of 6 multi-values allowed.
Up to 35 type S (SWIFT) characters.
Specifies the ID of the original incoming Message Header. This field will allow the user to automatically populate:
The SWIFT content of the Original Message in the ORG.MAN field.
The Message Type of the Original Message in the ORIGINAL.DATE field
The Date of the Original Message in the ORIGINAL.MSG.TYPE field and
The Transaction Reference Number of the Original Message in the REL.REFERENCE field
Either DE.I.HEADER.ID or DE.O.HEADER.ID is valid.
To change input, e.g. changes from DE.O.HEADER.ID to DE.I.HEADER.ID delete the DE.O.HEADER.ID to make DE.I.HEADER.ID inputtable.
'D' (Delivered) Year (4 numeric characters) Month (2 numeric characters) Day (2 numeric characters) Time (a 7-digit number taken from the computer's internal clock.)

p.DT: The Delivery Header Id must exist on the DE.I.HEADER File

desc.p: Standard audit field
Standard audit field
In the absence of the CUSTOMER.NO, this field should contain the S.W.I.F.T BIC Code prefixed with SW-, for either a T24 or non-T24 Customer.
If the customer ID is entered in the CUSTOMER.NO field, the text version of the customer address details will be automatically completed in this field.
If the customer ID is entered in the CUSTOMER.NO field, and a S.W.I.F.T. BIC address is entered in the RECV.ADDR field, then the CUSTOMER.NO field takes precedent.
An enrichement of the input will be made against the DE.BIC file if present.
The format of the characters follwing the SW- must be in the coreect S.W.I.F.T format.
System Maintained field. Value defaulted from EB.ADVICE.NO field that holds the key of EB.ACTIVITY / EB.ADVICES no.
System Maintained field. This field holds TODAY's system date.
This field contains the actual answer for the MTn96 (response to an MTn92 or MTn95).
Contains an Enquiry called - List of ANSWER Codes for SWIFT n96
This field is Inputtable and Mandatory only if MSG.CNTL.SUFFIX field is‘96’, otherwise optional.
A maximum of 6 multi-values allowed.
Up to 35 type S (SWIFT) characters.
Identifies details of the user to whom the message had been assigned to or who is dealing with the message.
3-16 type AA (alphanumeric, first character alpha) characters.
The User code must exist on the USER file.
Any existing User code will be accepted and the name redisplayed for checking.
